content: The North America Telugu Society (NATS) is a non-profit organization formed in 2009 by 200 volunteers. The organization serves Telugu communities in North America through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities, and provides a 24/7 helpline (1-888-483-5848) for emergency assistance. NATS also holds bi-annual conventions to celebrate Telugu culture, attracting approximately 8000 people. This year, the 7th annual convention is planned for May 26-28 at the Raritan Convention Center and will feature cultural, literary, and business events, along with forums for women and career development for young people. NATS invites dignitaries and state governors to participate in the main event.
